Detailed Description

This class provides the framework of a 3D Scene Viewer window.

The class CSceneViewer provides navigation through the scene with a default camera and default lighting. The custom 3D scene is specified by providing an Open Inventor object tree.

Example Program: 

//========================================================================
// Project: QWidgets++
// ----------------------------------------------------------------------
// Package: 3D Render Classes 
// Authors: Ankur Bhargava
// Start Date: Tue Jan 23 18:37:49 est 2001
// ----------------------------------------------------------------------
// File: CSceneViewerExample.cpp
//========================================================================

// ----- Standard Libaries -----
#include <iostream.h>

// ----- QRTS Libraries -----
#include "QWidgets.hpp"

// ----- Project Includes -----
#include "CSceneViewer.hpp"
#include "CRenderArea.hpp"

// ------ OpenInventor Includes ---- 
#include <Inventor/nodes/SoEnvironment.h>
#include <Inventor/nodes/SoTranslation.h>
#include <Inventor/nodes/SoSeparator.h>
#include <Inventor/nodes/SoSphere.h>

// =========================================
// ----- Class CSceneViewerExample ---------
// =========================================

class CSceneViewerExample : public CSceneViewer 
{
 public:    
  CSceneViewerExample ( CWidget *widget, char *title, int width =0, int height =0 );
  ~CSceneViewerExample ();
  virtual CSceneViewer *createNewObject ();
 
 private:
  SoSeparator *d_myScene; 
  void addMySphere ();  
};

// ================================================
// ----- CSceneViewerExample Constructor ----------
// ================================================

CSceneViewerExample::CSceneViewerExample ( CWidget *widget, char *title, 
int width, int height )
  :CSceneViewer ( widget, title, width, height )
{
  d_myScene = readOpenInventorFile ("jumpyMan.iv");
  d_myScene->renderCulling = SoSeparator::OFF;
  addMySphere (); 
  addOpenInventorSceneGraph (d_myScene);
  addAllMenus (); 
  setSideView (); 
}

// ================================================
// ----- CSceneViewerExample Destructor  ----------
// ================================================

CSceneViewerExample::~CSceneViewerExample ()
{
}

// ================================================
// CSceneViewerExample::addMySphere ()
// ================================================

void CSceneViewerExample::addMySphere ()
{
  SoSphere *mySphere = new SoSphere;  
  mySphere->radius.setValue (0.5);  
  d_myScene->addChild (mySphere);
}

//========================================================================
// CSceneViewerExample::createNewObject ()
//========================================================================

CSceneViewer * CSceneViewerExample::createNewObject ()
{
  CSceneViewerExample *babyExampleWindow 
    = new CSceneViewerExample ( 0," baby" , 300, 300);
  return babyExampleWindow;
}

//======================================================================== 
// main
//========================================================================  
 
int main ( int argc, char *argv[] )
{
  PtInit (0); 
  CSceneViewerExample *exampleViewer 
    = new CSceneViewerExample ( 0, "Example Scene", 400, 400);
  exampleViewer->realize ();
  PtMainLoop ();
  return 0;
}

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

CSceneViewer ( CWidget * parent,
char * title,
int width = 30,
int height = 30 )
 

The constructor allows you to specify a custom title, height and width for the Scene Viewer window. It creates a root node for the Open Inventor scene graph and adds a light and camera node to it. It also adds nodes for vertex ordering for the scene (Vertex ordering for OpenInventor files is set to "counter-clockwise" and shape hints to "unknown").

~CSceneViewer ( ) [virtual]
 

Virtual destructor.

Member Function Documentation

CMenuBar * addMenuBar ( CWindow * parent )
 

Adds a menu bar to the parent window.

Parameters:
parent   The window to which the menu bar will be attached.
Returns:
Pointer to the menu bar.

Example: 

   CSceneViewer *myViewer = new CSceneViewer ( 0, "Example", 200, 200 );
   myViewer->addMenuBar ();
   myViewer->addDefaultViewMenu ();

CMenu * addDefaultFileMenu ( )
 

Adds the default file menu to the menu bar. Note: A call to addMenuBar() must be made first.

Returns:
Pointer to the File menu.

CMenu * addDefaultViewMenu ( )
 

Adds the default view menu to the menu bar. Note: A call to addMenuBar() must be made first.

Returns:
Pointer to the View menu.

CMenu * addDefaultWindowMenu ( )
 

Adds the default window menu to the menu bar. Note: A call to addMenuBar() must be made first.

Returns:
Pointer to the Window menu.

CMenuBar * addAllMenus ( )
 

Creates the default menu bar and attaches it to the CSceneViewer. This default menu consists of File, View and Window menu.

Returns:
Pointer to the default menu bar to which the menus are attached.

SoSeparator * readOpenInventorFile ( const char * fileName )
 

This function reads the specified VRML file into the OpenInventor database and returns a pointer to the root node of the scene in the read file.

Parameters:
fileName   The name of the VRML file being read.
Returns:
Pointer to the root node of the read scene. 0 in case of error.

Example: 

   SoSeparator *myScene = readOpenInventorFile ("readFileName.iv"); 
   myScene->renderCulling = SoSeparator::OFF;
   addOpenInventorSceneGraph (myScene);

void setDefaultLightOn ( )
 

Sets the default light in the scene on, by enabling the switch node that is parent of the default light node.

void setDefaultLightOff ( )
 

Sets the default light off. If you decide not to use the default light then you need to create your own light node.

bool isDefaultLightOn ( )
 

Checks if the default light is enabled.

Returns:
true: light is on, false: light is off.

void addOpenInventorSceneGraph ( SoSeparator * mySceneRoot )
 

This function allows the user to attach the custom 3D scene. The whole user scene graph is added to the CSceneViewer scene.

Parameters:
mySceneRoot   The root node of the users scene graph.

CSceneViewer * createNewObject ( ) [virtual]
 

This function is called to open a new CSceneViewer window. The base class creates a new object of the type CSceneViewer. You must reimplement this function in the derived class to create a new object of the derived class.

Returns:
Pointer to the object of class CSceneViewer or a derived class.

Example: 

   CSceneViewer * myObject::createNewObject ()
   {
          myObject *babyExampleWindow = new myObject ( 0," baby" , 300, 300);
          return babyExampleWindow;
   }

int setFrontView ( )
 

This function sets the camera orientation along the +X axis and sets the position such that the whole 3D scene fits in the render area.

int setSideView ( )
 

This function sets the camera orientation along the -Z axis and sets the position such that the whole 3D scene fits in the render area.

Member Data Documentation

SoPerspectiveCamera * d_perspectiveCamera [protected]
 

Default camera node added by CSceneViewer. The user must not change the position or orientation of the camera.
